articles.headline: Trump and Pelosi Trade Barbs, Both Questioning the Other’s Fitness
articles.snippet: President Trump and Speaker Nancy Pelosi traded accusations that the other was unfit for office, as a war of words between the party leaders accelerated.
articles.abstract: President Trump and Speaker Nancy Pelosi traded accusations that the other was unfit for office, as a war of words between the party leaders accelerated.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The war of words between President Trump and Speaker Nancy Pelosi escalated in dramatic fashion on Thursday, with each leader questioning the other’s temperament and mental fitness in an extraordinary exchange of personal insults.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Michael Tackett

articles.headline: As California Wildfire Season Looms, Finding Tree Trimmers Is a New Problem
articles.snippet: For Pacific Gas & Electric, it isn’t easy mustering crews to thin the forests where its equipment might cause fires.
articles.abstract: For Pacific Gas & Electric, it isn’t easy mustering crews to thin the forests where its equipment might cause fires.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKHURST, Calif. — Pacific Gas & Electric has a big problem. Its equipment keeps coming into contact with dry trees and shrubs and starting devastating wildfires. So the company is scrambling to trim or cut down hundreds of thousands of trees across its vast Northern California territory.

articles.headline: Assange Indicted Under Espionage Act, Raising First Amendment Issues
articles.snippet: The WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange faces 17 counts in a superseding indictment over his role in obtaining and publishing classified documents in 2010.
articles.abstract: The WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange faces 17 counts in a superseding indictment over his role in obtaining and publishing classified documents in 2010.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks leader, has been indicted on 17 counts of violating the Espionage Act for his role in obtaining and publishing secret military and diplomatic documents in 2010, the Justice Department announced on Thursday — a novel case that raises profound First Amendment issues.

articles.headline: To Get Boeing 737 Max Flying, Global Consensus Will Be Hard
articles.snippet: One big sticking point is whether to require that pilots undergo additional training on a simulator. If the training is required, the planes would be grounded for longer than expected.
articles.abstract: One big sticking point is whether to require that pilots undergo additional training on a simulator. If the training is required, the planes would be grounded for longer than expected.
articles.lead_paragraph: FORT WORTH — Boeing and the Federal Aviation Administration want global consensus to get the 737 Max flying again. They may have to wait a while.
articles.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

articles.headline: Harvey Weinstein Is Said to Reach $44 Million Deal to Settle Lawsuits
articles.snippet: About $30 million would be set aside for women who have accused him, employees of his former studio and creditors, according to people briefed on the matter.
articles.abstract: About $30 million would be set aside for women who have accused him, employees of his former studio and creditors, according to people briefed on the matter.
articles.lead_paragraph: Harvey Weinstein and his former studio’s board members have reached a tentative $44 million deal to resolve lawsuits filed by women who accused him of sexual misconduct and by the New York State attorney general, according to three people briefed on the matter.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Jan Ransom

articles.headline: Huawei’s European Customers Are Put on Hold by U.S. Ban
articles.snippet: They’re unsure how Android phones will keep working as Google and other companies assess a Trump administration order.
articles.abstract: They’re unsure how Android phones will keep working as Google and other companies assess a Trump administration order.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Europe has been one of Huawei’s biggest success stories. Now it is on the front line of the trade and technology war between China and the United States.
articles.byline: By Amie Tsang and Adam Satariano

articles.headline: Pain of Tariffs Tests Farmers’ Faith in Trump: ‘How Long Is Short-Term?’
articles.snippet: The trade dispute with China has cost growers their No. 1 buyer, but they say the president is on the right course.
articles.abstract: The trade dispute with China has cost growers their No. 1 buyer, but they say the president is on the right course.
articles.lead_paragraph: OSSEO, Wis. — From the start, President Trump’s combative trade strategy toward China has carried the promise that short-term pain inflicted on farmers would be worth the longer-term gains for American producers, from agriculture to technology.

articles.headline: Trump Administration Proposes Rollback of Transgender Protections
articles.snippet: The Department of Health and Human Services proposed to roll back Obama-era protections of transgender people, narrowing the definition of sex for health care coverage.
articles.abstract: The Department of Health and Human Services proposed to roll back Obama-era protections of transgender people, narrowing the definition of sex for health care coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration formally proposed on Friday to roll back Obama-era civil rights safeguards that had banned discrimination against transgender medical patients and health insurance customers.
articles.byline: By Abby Goodnough, Erica L. Green and Margot Sanger-Katz

articles.headline: Potential Clash Over Secrets Looms Between Justice Dept. and C.I.A.
articles.snippet: The attorney general’s ability to declassify intelligence could put at risk a C.I.A. informant close to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
articles.abstract: The attorney general’s ability to declassify intelligence could put at risk a C.I.A. informant close to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s order allowing Attorney General William P. Barr to declassify any intelligence that led to the Russia investigation sets up a potential confrontation with the C.I.A. It effectively strips the agency of its most critical power: choosing which secrets it shares and which ones remain hidden.
articles.byline: By Julian E. Barnes and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Trump Circumvents Congress to Sell Weapons to Middle East Allies
articles.snippet: The Trump administration is equipping Saudi Arabia, the U.A.E. and Jordan, even as the president remains reluctant to increase the number of American military personnel on the ground.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration is equipping Saudi Arabia, the U.A.E. and Jordan, even as the president remains reluctant to increase the number of American military personnel on the ground.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump circumvented Congress on Friday by declaring an emergency over Iran and moving forward with arms sales to Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Jordan that had been blocked by Congress since last year.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Edward Wong and Catie Edmondson
